text: this has got to be my new favorite spot for sushi. my coworker Joey G., had recommended this spot for our next "team building" outing. we had a blast! Ellen... Yong (excuse my spelling) and the owner Gee(excuse my spelling here too).. are the best. very welcoming and i love the athmosphere. the food was excellent. i can honestly say that the night of food and beverage and all the laughs with great company.. makes this place a MUST!!

I'm just an avid Sushi lover in a town filled with Japanese-influenced cuisine, but it isn't as easy to find a great restaurant for such a raw delicacy as you might think. Furthermore, it is even more difficult to find a place that has delicious cocktails, scrumptious food, great and welcoming staff, AND a vivacious ambience. Do i need to say anymore? Come see why Kanji has such a high rating for yourself.
Great place. Only one other couple there. Impressive table chef ! It's like Benihana only..... without the crowd and all the noise. Great fresh food. I'll go back next time I'm in Vegas!
Great food great service Ji is awesome makes your sushi and conversates. Sushi is super yummy
Love the food and LOVE GEORGE!!!!! Awesome cook and entertainer! Definitely will be back!

This is absolutely NOT the place to come for teppanyaki - that is mediocre, at best!!!  This is the place to come for SUSHI!  Young, the sushi samurai is amazing and always wants to please.  I don't do menus, I negotiate my meal, I tell Young exactly what I want to eat (by ingredient) and he always makes sushi that far exceeds my expectations.  The sushi quality and creativity are outstanding and I bring ALL of my friends here for that reason.  If you like sushi, come to this lovely place, with the most friendly staff and enjoy some of Young's creations!

One of the best places to eat sushi in LV!

we started off with an order of sashimi plate. It was delicious... very fresh, big pieces, just the way I like it. The wasabi was freshly made so it was naturally sweet and spicy... very different from wasabi from a tube.

We ordered the 30 hour boiled pork. OMG! Couldnt and didnt stop talking about this dish the whoooole night. If you are there, it is a MUST order dish. All my praises to the chef who came up and put together all the ingredients into this one plate. 

We had the black bean noodle. It is one of my usual favorite foods I like to eat but this one was different. It had a distinctive flavor that made me talk about it, again,... the whoooole night.

The Kanji roll was very good. The shrimp tempura was amazing. The creme burlee was well made.
 
Hot sake was excellent!
To finish the night we had a cocktail that tasted like gummy bear. Another must get to finish off the night.

Go, and enjoy what the chef had put together.

Great sushi in the burbs! VERY fresh fish.  Amazing hamachi and we also had 6-layer roll which sounded weird with fish and steak but was really tasty.  I'm not a huge raw salmon fan but the salmon lover's roll was awesome. Vegan roll "April" was very tasty and not at all bland like a lot of vegetarian rolls could be.  Easy location to get to and the staff was very attentive and pleasant. The teppanyaki tables looked interesting but I'll stick with the sushi side.
Fantastic food....Jay the head chef was awesome and the food was unbelievable....I highly recommend the Kanji special...the best of everything..for what you get the price is more than reasonable

Only two very small bites of fatty meat on the Korean rib, and it cost $14 plus tax and tip.  That gets an F.  The pork sandwich was tasty and fairly priced.  The sushi was good.  The service got a B-.

This is my favorite teppanyaki and sushi place in Las Vegas. The inside atmosphere is nice. dining and sushi area is modern and orange color of ceiling is looking great! 

For the food, I highly recommend the prix-fixe menu for grills. This course comes with 3 entree which you can choose from kanji sp, landlover sp, sealover sp and appetizer and drinks. Also what emphasizes on food is their secret pink sauce! It makes every food tasty

They serve sushi as well so we could enjoyed sushi and teppanyaki together. I ordered few rolls kanji roll, what the heck, and something wrong #7. Among these three rolls, Kanji roll is the best and it is best roll i ever had!! 

I hope everyone visiting Las Vegas gives this place a shot

so  i was in the south west of town and went to kanji steak house.And had the Soy wings and the ono  basil.And a couple of signature drinks and it was awesome.taste was great and the staff was friendly.And no hesitation ill be back for the taste.Tthank you kanji.

The food was so delicious, the small plates are a must, the white tuna tasted like butter with the basil dressing. Don't forget to order the butter mochi for dessert. The sake bomb was free with a yelp check in. This place has a nice ambiance, servers are friendly and helpful with the menu.

I have been to several teppanyaki restaurants but kanji is the best i have tasted with the best service. I came here with my friend and we both got the kanji special and we also got the kanji roll. Both were amazing! The kanji special allowed us to try their best, including an appetizer and a drink. Our chef was joshua and he was great! He gave a sunflower show with eggs.  It was the first time I've seen something like that. Our server's name was annie and she took care of us the whole time we were there. She recommended us to try the uni and it was the freshest uni I have ever tried! when I asked about it she told me that they don't have it everyday but they buy the freshest and best uni to serve. Definitely ask your server about the uni!

We decided to come here for my sisters birthday under the impression it was still named geisha house since LVAC members receive a 10% discount, spoke to the waitress who relayed it to their manager and applied the 10% discount to our bill. They stated after agreeing to apply it they're are cheaper then geisha house, great we thought. Come to find out the portions of the food is tini (probably why they're cheaper), service was horrible, didn't receive our drinks till we reminded them of our order or even received refills. The only pleasant thing about the restaurant was the cook. Never will return here again!!!!!
Golden scallops are amazing. Gotta try them. Fried huge scallops with spicy mayo. Great snack while drinking :)
Love this place! So good, just got takeout and it was fresh and only took around 10 minutes. Good price and large portions! Will defiantly be back!!

My wife and family really enjoyed our dinner. The service was great and the food was even better. They had an array of  specialtie rolls. They were very well staffed as it was very clean. WE WILL BE BACK !

I like this place for multiple reasons. I have been here multiple times now and each my visits has been very pleasant. 

First, the wait staff are very polite and very attentitive. I've rarely had to flag anyone down to get anything. Someone is always looking to top off our drinks and ask how everything is going. 

Second(maybe lastly?), the food is great. I've had many dishes from the teppan side as well as the sushi side. The meat and seafood have always been fresh and cooked perfectly to order. The teppan chefs are entertaining and very pleasant to interact with. We did havr one chef who missed on a few of his tricks but I wont penalize the restaurant for what is essentially free entertainment. ; )

Finally! The prices are a bit higher than other places I've been around town but I'm willing to pay the extra cost for the good service, friendly staff, and casual atmosphere. 

I would definitely and already have recommended this place to my friends!

This is our FAVORITE Japanese restaurant by far! 
We've been here multiple times and every time there is great service, nice ambiance, good music.
We like to have the sushi for happy hour. Our favorite is the Rocky Mountain; it has scallops, saut√©ed onions, mushrooms, shrimp tempura plus some other fixings that we've never had in a roll anywhere else. I had my mom try it today for her first time and it's now her favorite. Also, My grandma never liked raw fish but today she tried the salmon carpaccio(?sp) and she really liked it.
They have introduced some new dishes that are pretty unique, including that salmon carpaccio and another one involving yellowtail- all delicious. And very good attention to detail. 
Ellen is an outstanding ambassador to this restaurant and she knows us by name :). We also appreciate the rest of the staff here. They are attentive and I especially appreciated them catering to my sweet grama :)
They also have hibachi here if that's more your speed. We haven't tried it yet but it usually always gets pretty packed at dinner time so I think people like it :P
You won't regret your visit here!

3/20 Thursday - Stopped in to check this place out with the wife and son to get some of the super star sushi and more after reading the super reviews. However it was very strange I asked for 2 orders of UNI and the waitress said we don't have UNI today.  I'm thinking ok let's try the golden scallops hmmm they came out layered in bread cold  and no flavor. The wife orders the 3 course meal seafood hmmm another mistake zero flavor lobster hard as a rock with some sort of sauce on the side. Then some sort of beef liquid soup comes with a few mushrooms on top. Tasted like it was from beef bullion cubes nasty.  Lastly the manager or Ji stops by the table and says come back tomorrow that's when our UNI comes in fresh Friday.. Aaaah no we won't be back....I don't need a free sake to make things alright when you bring the check. I have found most sushi bars that aren't owned by Japanese are substandard.  I have been around the world to a few hundred sushi bars.

I came here for a meet up so we had the patio to ourselves. But it was hot and humid outside, they don't have misters or even fans. And there were flies on the tables. They didn't automatically give us soy sauce and wasabi for d rolls, we had to ask. They were understaffed. It took a good half hour for them to bring out my spider roll. It was just alright. And it took 25 minutes to get my check. Actually I asked d guy 3 times to give me my check until I just couldn't stay any longer I had to get up and wait for them at the counter.

A short while back, I heard through the grapevine that the Chef Hong from Moko had recently joined the team at Kanji. I enjoyed the food at Moko and was excited to try the food at his new digs. Unfortunately, by the time you are reading this review, Chef Hong has left the building. But on a brighter note, many of the changes he had implemented are in place, and even without him being there, I liked what I saw at the "new" Kanji.

Kanji offers many different kinds of eating experiences that are sure to please the palette. First, you have traditional sushi, where you can order nigiri, and hand rolls, and other items typically seen at a sushi restaurant. Then, you have teppanyaki, or as I like to call it, dinner and a show, where a chef will cook for you in front of your eyes, and will also interact with fun tricks (did anyone say volcano onion?) And lastly, they offer modern asian-style entrees and appetizers, ones that if you are familiar with Moko, will know.

Since Chef Hong wasn't there, I decided to go with the teppanyaki route. If you had never been to a teppanyaki, I would highly recommend that you try Kanji's. Our chef was funny and chill. I ordered the chicken and beef combo. I then received the yelp check in offer for a sake bomb. What was kinda different was that they let us choose from about 5 different flavored sake's. I've only had a straight up one, so I was curious about the mango flavor. Hesitant at the fact that the mango flavor would not go well with the beer, I was surprised by how well they went together.

We were then given our soup and salad. Pretty basic teppanyaki flair, but did the job serviceably. The soup was good, and the salad was crisp. Then the chef started cooking the fried rice. I thought that the flavor was good, however, the rice was slightly undercooked. Then the proteins came next. The chicken was moist and well seasoned and so was the beef. I enjoyed it a lot. Our chef then cooked the veggies. They are a little heavy on the zucchini here, not my thang, but I thought it all tasted pretty good. The chef from the kitchen then sent us out a special of shrimp tempura that had been wrapped with a piece of tuna. Mikey likey.

I don't do teppanyaki very often because it gives me flashbacks of my crazy first job in the kitchen as a rebellious teenage boy in Ellicott City, MD. But, if I were to chose any place to go for it, Kanji would definitely be at the top of my list.
I just found this place and love it!! Great food and service, a must if you live or visiting the west side!

My favorite restaurant in town, yes in town, right now. I feel like royalty given that it's 2 minutes away from my house. 

All pros:
* The have the freshest fish. 

*Miso Chilean sea bass is to die for. Melts in your mouth... And it's only $13. 
 
*30 hour pork is the perfect texture, absolutely delicious 

* short rib with Lima bean pur√©e is delicious. So tender, decadent, but familiar like a perfectly cooked home cooked meal 

* what the heck roll is my favorite. It's hot, sweet and savor. The veggie "salsa on top makes it.  

*staff is incredibly attentive and personable. Very lively with the sake bombs... Especially when they build pyramids out of shot glasses 


Couldn't say enough about this place. Go there. Actually, don't. I want to keep this place all for myself

We order take out from here once a week, we have ordered over 15 times. Not once has the food been ready at the stated time. We even now go 10 minutes after the stated time and it's still not ready when we arrive. I asked the manager what the deal was and she stated "the chef doesn't like to make it till you arrive. "  Defeats the purpose of take out. They advised me to state over the phone I want it ready when I arrive! So now I do, and it's still never ready. That's no one's fault but management. Lame

Stopped in for a recent happy hour with a large group of people. The reservations were made in advance with this restaurant & how many people to expect. One would assume they would have adequate staff to attend to a large party...nope. Ended up getting sat on the patio in the middle of August during monsoon season. No rain but humid. Had sweat dripping down the side of my face for the 1st hour. Ugh. They do not have ceiling fans, misters or anything to keep you cool on the patio. I understand that it's $ to get that stuff but at least get some free standing large fans to help cool people down if you're going to sit them on the patio. And the flies on the patio were unreal. I have never had such an issue with flies in the 8+ years living in Vegas. These flies didn't care if you swatted them away...they came back for more & would not stay away. Gross.  

Now on to the food & service. Holla to the Yelper's that mentioned the free sake bomb w/ Yelp check-in. 1st drink was free. Their review stars just went downhill after that. Service was so horribly slow to get food or drinks. They only had 1 person waiting on like 20 on the patio. One of the people with me had to ask 3 times for their check & still never received it but finally went & stood in front of the hostess stand to get their attention to pay her bill. Others kept asking about their food & when it was coming out. I ordered the Rock N Roll roll (Assorted Fish, Gobo, Kaiware, Avocado, Crab; Out: Cucumber, S.O. Sauce on the Side). For the price they charge for this roll it's not worth it. $14.50 for fake crab on the inside. All the "assorted" fish were tiny pieces all standing on their ends on the end of the roll rather than being layered over each piece of the roll. This roll is more about presentation than anything. We did not try their habachi grills but the menu seemed expensive (almost the same as Benihana prices). I might give them another shot by going for a happy hour with a couple of friends but doubtful it would ever be for a meal as their prices seem pretty expensive.

I'm a beginner when it comes to sushi aka I have no idea what tempura, sashimi, etc., means. We asked the waitress what the most popular orders were and selected 2 since we weren't that hungry. Ordered Taste My Ex Girlfriend and Kanji Roll.
The Kanji Roll was AMAZING. 10/10. Must-try. Ex-Girlfriend was okay. 
Definitely going back to try hibachi and the lunch bentos. That's already 2 promised future visits, in addition to wanting to taste the Kanji Roll again :)

We came here once for the hibachi. Steak and shrimp...yum! And had a pretty amazing experience. While we were waiting we ordered sushi, specifically the kanji roll. It was AMAZING. We knew we had to go back and try all the sushi. Which we did. Holy cow. Taste my Ex Girlfriend is probably the best sushi roll I ever had. We also did the hulk, the vampire, and a couple other rolls I forgot. Even though they have a limited selection of specialty rolls, each one was handcrafted perfectly. This has officially become our new favorite sushi spot. On top of it all, we went during happy hour where all sushi rolls are 30% off, so the bill didn't even break $50 for 6 rolls. Much cheaper than AYCE sushi we usually get.

Best sushi in Las Vegas. HANDS DOWN. 
I am so lucky to live close to Kanji. My favorite rolls are What the Heck and the Kanji. We also love the filet mignon and lobster hibachi.

Awesome food! Love kanji roll, and fried rice were great too!
Very clean place, friendly staff, it was great!
This time we did the teppanyaki and we were not disappointed!  Tons of food & really good too!!

Kanji, which is soon to be another Jjanga, is our favorite sushi place. The sushi is not only excellent but the experience, customer service, and employees make this place shine. Sushi chef's Ji and Sponge have served us on our two most recent visits, making rolls that alway exceed our expectations. We have tried the (new and old) Vampire (they have slightly changed recipes for some rolls since their transition), Kanji roll (which is no longer on the menu), Taste like my ex girlfriend, chu chu riceless roll, spicy tuna (only $3!!!!!), and a few others. There menu prices have now changed and Kanji is now more affordable than ever!! The place is alway clean and friendly, bright yet personal, we always have such a wonderful experience with the staff. Ellen is so kind and fun, I feel like the staff at Kanji are a part of my family. We were coming often even before the prices changed, now Kanji is easily affordable a few times a week! $21 for three HEAPING rolls? #sold. Don't walk, run. You won't regret it.

I've had Kanji bookmarked, so when my friends asked where we should go, I made the suggestion. Yelpers didn't let me down this time, yay!! We chose the sushi side. The food was all wonderfully fresh and tasty, our favorite was the Kanji Roll. Kudos to a wonderful sushi chef! Great service as well, our waitress and other girls that helped bring stuff out were all fast, efficient, helpful and friendly. At the end of our meal, the nice chef offered us a complimentary roll, everyone was full but we were not going to turn it down. Everything was perfect...I can't wait to return over and over!
Awesome place. Great service, Free mango sake, fun atmosphere,  very clean too. Sushi was fresh, creative & tastes amazing.
It was so good~~~  everything was great , every time i order sushi n rolls chef young made exactly what i want. Thank you .chef young .

So this is a sushi/teppinyaki restaurant that newly opened. 

Here is my first impression

The staff here is very friendly. I felt very welcome when I walked in. The place looked well put together and very modern in Asian theme. 

I tried both the sushi and the teppinyaki. 

Sushi

I noticed the sushi guy washed his hands before he started working in my food. I enjoy seeing that. 

I ordered a 12 pieces sashimi.  Tuna,  salmon, and yellow tail. The fish was extremely fresh.  5 stars! 
The chef also surprised me with fresh wasabi! It was amazing! I had never tried it. Always had that green mashed processed stuff. 

I also ordered a rainbow roll. 

The chef was a master at making the rolls. The flavors kicked into each other superbly. 5 stars

The teppinyaki is also amazing. I had the steak and shrimp. The chef did a bunch of cool tricks and made the whole experience fun. Their signature red butter makes everything taste amazing. The steak was perfect! 

Everything came in a timely manner. The staff was very pleasant.

I didn't feel like I over paid when the bill came through. The whole experience was wonderful. 

I would recommend this place to my friends. Two thumps up!

I came here for my 25th birthday dinner on Friday! I have to say, this place was amazing! The service was the best I received during my vacation in Las Vegas & the food was amazing! My drink never got low and the cook was so funny. I will definitely be stopping here every Vegas trip I make!

I have a weekly craving for sashimi more than sushi and oh so expensive habit!  New to LV I'm exploring off the strip -  Kanji is a hidden jewel.  I went for an early dinner to avoid the crowd, sat at the bar and looked at the menu - no Seaweed Salad and no hand rolls! I started chatting about it to Chef Yung and he said he would still prepare it for me!!! I ordered Sake and asked him to join me - Kampai!  Fresh & crunchy seaweed salad and the most divine Unagi Hand roll followed by sake!  Topping it off with a 10 PC sashimi platter and he treated me to complimentary fresh wasabi OMG!  I asked him about the Sake bomb free for checking in on Yelp!  I passed - beer and sake are deadly hangovers for me :( Sashimi was pure heaven, melted in my mouth.  Folks it's happy hour from 4-7pm.  It's a fairly spacious place, family environment & first dates to test if you want a second date LOL.  Waitress was attentive and greeter at entrance seated me promptly.  I will be taking a friend there soon on a busy crowded night - hope Chef Yung remembers me :D lots of parking and other businesses to get a foot massage, nail salon etc.
Yummerz! Jjanga the owner and sushi chef served us up some delicious creations! So friendly and great service. Loved it!
New fave sushi spot, everyone is super cool and chill, food is super amazing and the only place where they serve flavored sake bombs !!! And the interior is fab!!

We tried this place for the first time this past weekend. We live in the area and have been trying to find new places for our sushi fix. First off, the customer service is great. We did have to wait too long between visits from our waitress, but everyone was extremely friendly. We definitely felt welcome. To preface, my favorite roll to try at every sushi place I go is a Tiger roll and I was disappointed with it here. There was no sauce. The fish and shrimp tempura weren't outstanding either. I also tried the bacon roll and wasn't entirely satisfied. That being said, we enjoyed a Chef's special roll that was brought to us. I am not entirely sure what was in it but it was good! The rest of my party enjoyed their meals. Plus points for red bean ice cream!

We love this place!! Ji the owner is one of the nicest people and Ellen and staff are superb. We probably spend to much time here but we think between having the best sushi and the best staff in Vegas you can't loose! Not expensive either. They make you feel part of a family not a customer! Five star for sure.

In terms of hibachi restaurant experiences, Kanji is on the top of my list. The large open space has 4 hibachi grills with open seating around them. Yes, you might sit next to a stranger (gasp!), but isn't that half the fun? The staff was excellent and made our evening a joy. Dropping the sake into our sake bombs, being quick with a refill and even taking some flavored sake shots with us. Speaking of, you should def imbibe in a few of those shots. They are delicious and relatively low in potency. 

The food was excellent as well. The steak was cooked perfectly to order and stayed tender (I always find that food cooked on a hibachi grill it hardens up rather quickly), scallops were large, beef tataki was tatasty and the fried rice and accompanying sauces were great accompaniments to the meat. I've had quite a few hibachi chef's who come in, do their routine and then walk off like nothing happened. That wasn't the case here. Our dude, was crackin' jokes, talking to us, making some new rice art (Sponge Bob!) and an all around good dude. 
 
Grab a group of friends and head on over here! (Just make sure you go low sodium for a few days after). 

Protip: free sake bomb with Yelp check-in!
This place is awesome! The staff is very friendly and the sushi is the best I've ever had! If you're on west side of town this place is a must visit! You WILL come back

Very impressed with the new interior of the restaurant!

I ordered the strip steak habachi which comes with miso soup, salad, side of lemon butter shrimp, fried rice & veggies.

It was delicious and fun to watch.

I also ordered the super white tuna sushi and it was probably the best Ive ever had! it melts in your mouth.

Sake is also priced perfectly (and selection is HUGE) ask Ji to pair it with your dinner of choice!

Service was fast and generous for our party of 7 including a 3 year old. 

Will be back for more!

This became our Sushi Spot. The atmosphere is awesome. The food is simply amazing. The staff Is super awesome. Everyone is so friendly & attentive. They have an awesome Happy Hour. Prices are on point. Oh did we tell you how much we lovvvveeeee this place?

Teppanyaki is synonymous with delicious, and Kanji had teppanyaki, so that means... Kanji is delicious!

When I walked in with my friend to get some dinner, we were greeted and the staff was quite friendly with me. That always gets good praise in my book! Wouldn't anyone agree that things just get better with a friendly staff?

Their teppanyaki menu is fairly simple so nobody should have a real problem deciphering the menu, maybe just figuring out how much and what kind of meat you want, which is where the real challenge lies most of the time. What's awesome is that if you are feeling a little hungrier than normal, instead of getting the basic teppanyaki, they have a combos that come with a drink, an appetizer, and 3 set meats, which is what I got. The Kanji special is personally what I found to be the best thing to get on the menu since it comes with lobster, fillet mignon, and chicken, which is only a little bit extra compared to the other specials and definitely worth it!

After ordering, the chef soon came and started the show. My favorite thing he did was the little volcano that he made with the onions which I haven't seen before, and so I though that was quite creative. The meat was all cooked very well. The fillet mignon was tender, along with the chicken and lobster. My friend and I also sampled something from their sushi menu, which was quite delicious! If that was a look into how the rest of their sushi menu is, then I can't see how they would disappoint at all. And for those who like sake... they have flavored options. My friend ordered the pomegranate flavor and boy howdy, that was some good stuff. I know people will enjoy their alcohol here. And if this entices you, you get a free sake bomb with a yelp check in. It was a school day for me when I went, so maybe next time. 

For normal everyday people, this isn't an everyday kind of restaurant, but I would recommend coming here for special occasions. You won't have a problem with the staff or the quality of the food whatsoever, in which both are excellent. Have some fun every once in a while, kick back, and enjoy a great time with your friends at Kanji!
Great place! Everyone was friendly and the 'taste my ex girlfriend' roll was really good! I would definitely recommend this place!
Always a favorite spot for great apps and sushi. Sake selection is amazing. Best Gyoza's in town! Still have yet to find time for Paint Nite.

I came here for lunch after reading all the Yelp reviews. 

We each ordered a bento box. Me, the salmon and my love the bulgogi. His was better than mine. I dont know, I haven't been diggin salmon lately and shouldnt've ordered it, but I did because I didn't think I liked bulgogi. Big mistake. Thankfully, my love is more than happy to share his (really, let me eat it) and eat mine so it doesnt go to waste. My favorite part, it's so freakin lame I can't believe I'm saying it, was the macaroni salad that came with it. How weird is that. No wasibi, nothing special really but sooooo good. I ate all of my and his!
I liked the salad in the bento. I wasn't crazy about the cali roll. The tempura was really good too. It was fried nicely and not greasy at all. 
The lunch menu was very limited. I'd like to come back for dinner and see what that's like.

The service was great, the prices were very good, and I did enjoy my lunch.
I definitely see myself coming back here again.

"SAKE SAKE BOOM BOOM !
SAKE SAKE BOOM BOOM !"

Oh, not right now? Well, if you had a fun group like we did and everyone was doing sake bombs then that is what you would be chanting before you take your group shot. Remember to out-do any groups surrounding you.. That's what we tried to do. Tip: Try their pomegranate one ;)

I have been here before when it was Geisha House and it did NOT impress me so I am glad that it is now Kanji. If you have never tried teppanyaki before then I suggest trying it here so you can see it done right.

The staff is attentive, hilarious, and will drink with you. 
Pro Tip: Do the Ji Shot (thank me later).

My favorite starter was the Beef Tataki, great presentation and tasted amazing. The egg rolls and shrimp tempura were also ordered and shared amongst all of us. 

Our teppan chef was Joshua, who was very skilled and entertaining. He kept our group cracking up the whole time he was cooking our food on the iron griddle. Thanks for giving us food shaped as a big heart, Spongebob, flowers, and all the other things you came up with during the cooking process! It was all so delicious, especially the steak.

I will be back for more and to try out the Green Tea Cheesecake that I was too full to order!

So, 

My wife and I often frequent this restaurant. 

However, before I begin my review, you'll need to know that over the course of the past few months, there have been many changes to the restaurant. 

The hours have changed considerably, along with their Head Chef, and Menu. 

All of these things, I feel are for the better. 

The atmosphere feels different with the new menu. The food items on the menu seem  more thought out and intentional than they used to be. No more run-of-the-mill items on the dinner menu. 

With these new menu changes come new prices, and portions. The prices have gone up a bit and the portions have decreased.(Dinner Items only, Teppanyaki and Sushi have remained the same price and portion, which is great!) The sense that I get from these new food items is that they are for enjoyment and not necessarily to fill ones belly. It's all about the flavor now! Presentation has increased dramatically as well. Every dish seems artfully prepared and presented in an appealing and clean manner. 

Now, on to the dishes that I had and remember. 

My wife and I attended a taste test session for their new menu. I believe we received a total of 8 dishes including dessert. I'll do my best to go over them and explain what they are!(Not in the order in which we received them)

First, I believe was the Tuna Poke. The fish was fresh and lightly seasoned. It was presented into a perfectly fried wonton bowl. The portion we received was bite sized and perfect for a single person. (I have not had this outside of the tasting, so I don't know if portions vary) This occurred a few months ago, so I don't exactly recall the specific flavors, only that it was a bit tangy/sour. It went well with the fried wonton. 

Next, was smoked salmon and I believe smoked tuna or yellowtail(I honestly can't recall right now!) paired with assorted veggies and/or fruit. The salmon came wrapped around greens with a sprig or two on top. The sauce was a kind of orange, citrus-like sauce. Worked surprisingly well with a smoked salmon. The other dish, the fish was rolled separately from the veggies, which also included apples if I remember correctly. The tart of the apple really worked with the smoked fish and the sauce. 

Next, I believe, we had a baked sea bass with green beans. The Sea bass and clean and buttery. Very mild on the pallet, while the green bean seemed to have been pickled. It had a very sharp vinegar taste that at first, was quite offensive to the pallet. Then you immediately take a bite of the Sea Bass and you forget how tangy the green bean was. They really balanced each other out. 

Next, we had the Short Rib. The Short Rib was expertly cooked, the portions weren't anything to write home about, but again, this was a menu tasting, not a full blown meal. However, the meat was delicious. It came on a bed of a light sauce that really accentuated the full savory flavor of the beef. On top were deep friend garlic flakes. At first I thought these were almond flakes, but they definitely had a sweetness and kick to them that only garlic could. 

Next, we had 30 hour pork. This pork was melt in your mouth good. Resting on a bed of Zucchini noodles, the savoriness of the pork with the tangy sauce on the noodles really created an interesting balance in flavors and textures. The meat breaks apart at each chew, while the noodles resist and give a nice crunch. A very interesting piece that I would definitely like to enjoy again. 

Next, we had an eggplant salad. Personally, I am not a huge fan of eggplant. The only way I've ever really enjoyed eggplant was when it was covered in cheese, marinara, and then deep fried. The eggplant salad was very palatable, the texture of the eggplants was soft and very giving. The greens carried a freshness and pleasant tang to them. A quick snap from the pickled onions. 

Finally, we have the dessert. The Butter Mochi. If I understood this correctly, this is all made in-house by the Head Chef. The Mochi doesn't carry the typical presentation, but it lays beautifully atop a bed of Coconut Custard. The richness of the Butter Mochi and chilled temperature and taste of the Coconust Custard go really well together. THe mochi usually comes out warm, while the Custard is nice and cold. The pairing seems to go well together and i am always left desiring more. 

The price can become a little steep if you forget yourself, but the new menu is amazing and definitely worth trying. The new Head Chef really seems to know what he is doing. He also seems much more adventurous with his creations. 

All in All, I would definitely recommend this place for dinner!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(300/365) "Chef Hong's New Home"

I've had Moko Tapas Bar bookmarked for the longest time,  and was bummed I couldn't make the UYE at Moko set up by Victoria Q. and Mike C. awhile back.

Word on the street was that Chef Hong had moved on to Kanji, located right next door to DW Bistro,  so our party of 7 met up one evening for some Omakase action. The front of the house manager Ellen welcomed us and from the start provided stellar service which added to our overall experience. A line of Sake Bombs started us off, then course by course, Chef Hong amazed each and every one of us by his culinary creativity. Here is what we enjoyed:

STEAK TARTARE
Seared Filet Mignon, Kimchee, and Chimichurri on Toasted Crostini
-Soft, meaty tenderloin intermingled with the Kimchee and Chimichurri, thoughtfully balanced, and nice textural crunch from the crostini

FISH TRIO-HOUSE SMOKED SALMON, AHI POKE, HOUSE SMOKED HAMACHI
-The salmon was smoked with orange wood, paired with an orange sauce, orange segments, kelp powder, and micro greens. The poke was seasoned with their Kanji poke sauce, macadamia nuts, and a crispy wonton chip. The Hamachi was smoked on  apricot wood and had the same garnish as the salmon, but with green apple and an apricot sauce instead. Each fish preparation was tasty, but my favorite of the three was the poke.

EGGPLANT SALAD
-Grilled Eggplant, Charred Shishito Peppers, Daikon, Baby Mixed Greens, Cherry Tomatoes were topped with their signature Kanji Dressing

**PAN SEARED BRONZINI (Bonus surprise #1)
-I love fish that is prepared skin on, and to start our hot courses, this European Sea Bass was crisp, fatty, and seared to perfection, paired with dehydrated zucchini noodles. **Note: Not on Kanji's menu...specially prepared by Chef Hong for us.

MISO CHILEAN SEA BASS
-expertly glazed with miso and honey the buttery texture played off well with the pickled snap of the string beans

**DUCK CONFIT (Bonus surprise #2)
-At a Sushi/Teppenyaki joint??? Totally unexpected, but very well received. This course definitely showcased Chef Hong's classical European cooking techniques which were deliciously prepared with a Date Sauce and Fig Chutney **Note: another curve ball surprise thrown at us by Chef Hong's creativity that is NOT on Kanji's menu

10 HOUR BRAISED PORK BELLY
-Expertly prepared a la sous vide atop an Acorn Quesadilla, rich, fatty, unctous..all that...never had acorn anything and this definitely was a great first

KOREAN SHORT RIB
-Pulling from his Korean roots, Chef Hong hit us with another delicious, hearty meat course balanced out with silky smooth Lima Bean Puree and crisp golden Garlic Chips

MISO SOUP
-Pleasant surprise in between to wash away the richness and warm us up for yet... another course!?

NIGIRI COMBINATION
-Kanji's Head Sushi Chef made sure we didn't leave hungry and assembled a platter for each of us! Suzuki, Salmon Belly, Hamachi Belly, Anago, and Homemade Tamago (light, delicate, and some of the best Tamago I've had)

BUTTER MOCHI
-Always room for dessert, right? Chef Hong takes a Local Hawaiian Dessert and lightens it by mixing different flours to add a soft texture to a usually gummy mouth feel as butter mochi is,and pairs it with a Lemon-Coconut Custard and a Chocolate Hazelnut Sauce. Not overly sweet, and a perfect ending to a mind blowing meal!

Totally stuffed and just reflecting on one of the best dining experiences this year, we all thanked Ellen and Chef Hong for hosting us and looking forward to returning for another culinary adventure. For those of you who missed out on Moko while Chef Hong was there, or if you've had a so-so experience at Kanji in the past, I STRONGLY suggest you pay a return visit while he is in charge and experience the stellar service by Ellen and the revamped menu items and small plates created by Kanji's New Executive Chef who is a diamond in the rough waiting to shine in the Vegas local chef's scene. This duo is the greatest partnership to happen in a restaurant ever since Jax and Chef Ramil at Yonaka...ALOHA!!!

Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  10

Great service from beginning to end, solid sushi, creative and innovative flavors, cannot wait to return! Bookmark it!  NOW!!!

Love this place been here a few times, usually get  
a free sake bomb (with check in) 
the Johnny Roll (no rice)
Caterpillar Roll
Yellowtail Lover (didn't care for much)
Taste My ExGirlfriend
Cucumber Salad
House Salad

Free miso soups (for lunch)

Third times a charm!!! This restaurant has gone through diff names and changes but honestly I think this time it will stick around. This is my second time here and everyone was so attentive and ready to help you. The food was so flavorful and fresh. It can get a little loud at times but it's only because everyone is enjoying themselves and having a good time. The owner really makes u feel welcome like he's known u forever. I def recommend this place. I hope they continue to keep the same ambiance, freshness of food and attentiveness to customers. Never an empty cup.

As far as hibachi places go, this one will have to be in my top three. We went for mother's day on Sun and it was pretty empty. I don't think people realized that they had special hours for that day, but it was nice since it felt like we had the whole restaurant to ourselves. The place was very clean and nicely decorated. The ambiance was perfect! Even the bathrooms were really clean, and that says a lot about an establishment!!! The staff was very nice and attentive. Our hibachi chef was very entertaining and interactive. The miso soup was a hit, it was unlike the normal miso soup... Even my husband and cowboy step dad ate the whole thing! The food was excellent! Portions were more than enough. I had the filet minion, lobster, and shrimp. The sauces that went along with each were soooooooo yummy. I would definitely come here again and would highly recommend!
Had the chicken bento box.  Chicken was fresh.  Salad was disappointing.  Rolls were good.
Very tasty rolls, sushi chefs very friendly and loved the 90's R&B music as well haha. I will be back for teppan

This place was such a real treat after a long week.  I finally got to meet up with a fellow Yelper and his wife who I can happily say are official friends of ours now at this place.  Ambience is quiet and casual, but the food is very very good.

I had the beef braised ribs, egg rolls, and 30 hour pork.  Every item I sampled even our friends plates, who had sea bass and mochi bread type dessert (forgot the name) was EXCELLENT.  I couldn't find one flaw and service was great.  They even have flavored type saki, which was a first for me.  I had the blueberry raspberry flavor and I honestly wanted more, but I was so full!  I came here once before when it was Geisha House and to be honest this place is much better.  I hope to come again soon!

What a lovely place! I even redeemed a FREE SAKE BOMB! yay! Loved chef special course called Omakase which including appetizer, sushi, roll, salad, drink, EVERYTHING :) It was way more worth than I expected. I came back with my girl friends for teppanyaki and they also loved! We spent great time at there. Special thanks to Ji, the owner. He has an excellent customer service skills! Will definitely come back :) See you soon, Ji!

We've been here twice and both times had sushi, which was wonderful. Their happy hour specials are decent and I would definitely recommend stopping by and trying them out. Next time we go we're going to try their hibachi which going by their sushi should be pretty damn good. Oh, don't forget to check in to get your free sake bomb!
Good happy hour. Kanji roll is awesome. Great fresh salmon and Philadelphia roll. Will come back again! Check in on yelp and get a free sake bomb.

I saw they offer what sounds like a traditional japanese bento box on their menu like in all the other japanese restaurant, 4oz steak, miso soup, rice and salad for $9.95, I thought the portion is just right for me even though it's a "kids meal", the waitress took the order anyway, then manager walked up to me and said sorry it's for 12 year younger only, seriously? I don't know what else to order so then I just ordered a $3 fried rice and left hungry, fried rice is too salty by the way.  If I'm the chef who really care about the food, I care my customer finish the meal and like it, and not worry about what "kind" of people ordering the food.  Will not come back just for that reason.

This is my very favorite sushi restaurant ever! The Kanji roll is amazing! Yung is the BEST sushi chef in Vegas, there is NO competition or comparison. Ji is a great owner, very involved in making sure the customer always has the best experience. Every member of the Kanji family has always been so catering and so welcoming to me and my friends. Top notch food, service and amazing staff, thank you Kanji!

I'm in love!! Went here just for the grill and thought I'd try their sushi out. Im a little picky when it comes to sushi since I eat so much of it. It was so fresh! And their spicy garlic edemame was amazing! We got a filet and (I think lobster) from the grill.... And their rice.. YUMMYYYY! Always very entertaining when making out food. And the servers have always been nice and quick service. Also they are always sweet and understanding to my not so well behaved toddler. Never had any reason to leave less than 25% tip. If I can afford to I usually side tip the chef grilling since they do so much work Are friendly and entertaining. My husband and I are both servers and are always impressed. it is a little pricey for us otherwise we would be there a lot more!!
So so so good awesome sushi chef and the service is outstanding definitely stop by if you are in the area!!!

We went to this sushi place late Friday night.  It is a pretty big place, loved the music lol. We ordered the "vampire roll" (one of my favorite), "taste my ex girlfriend roll" (also delicious), the "beef tataki" I did not really care for it ( meat tasted like it was cook in the microwave), house salad (good dressing). Our server was nice ( a little slow for an empty place). We will definitely go back for the sushi rolls, they were so fresh. Probably one of the best I had.

I've been here three times and I LOVE this place. This is quality grade sushi with an awesome happy hour every day from 4-7 on the patio and in the sushi bar. 

Formerly Geisha House, the new place is nothing comparable. The interior is all open and beautiful, with plenty of tables and an inviting atmosphere. Service is very friendly and quick. I've eaten at both the sushi bar and tables in the dining area. I actually prefer the bar because you get a little faster service when ordering food. 

this is NOT an AYCE place but you really won't miss it, I promise. See my pics. Mouthwatering Yellowtail Lover is my favorite. 

Yelp Tip of the Day! Check in with your Yelp app and get a free sake bomb! Woot woot!
So delicious!! The 3 course meal is amazing-highly recommend it!! Not to mention they carry our favorite sake, Bonzai Bunny in Blueberry. Love that it's so good and so close to home. =)
Excellent, quick & friendly service.  Great food.  We ordered 6 different items of sushi during happy hour & was done eating in 40 mins.

Free sake bomb with check in. Yes please. Had a great time with the hubby. We got sat down quick on a Friday night. Ordered the flavored sake sampler which was really good. Ordered few more sake bombs as well. We didn't have to wait for anyone else to arrive. I ordered sushi and hubby ordered steak. Perfect combo! The tuna poke was soo good. The servers were really nice and accommodating. They did forget our drink orders a couple times but everyone makes mistakes. There is a yogurt shop across the street and even through we were stuffed we walked over there. Overall great night. Place is next to DW BIstro. They say it's hit or miss on how busy they are so I wouldn't worry about making a reservation unless you have a big group.

Love Kanji! We have their sushi once a week. The Kanji and Taste My Ex Girlfriend rolls are so yummy. The ingredients are very fresh and we have never been let down by any of their rolls. We usually order togo, but the ambiance is very nice if you eat inside and the service is great. You won't be disappointed!

I was really looking forward to trying this place it had good reviews and wasn't too far from home.
It was a week day around 5 and it was pretty empty so we got a hibachi grill to ourselves. We put our orders in and not too long later we got some miso soup which was  different from most miso but I liked it. The salad was the typical salad with ginger dressing. The chef came out shortly after I think his name was Joshua. He did the normal shtick but was very dry, didn't  have much "stage presence". We didn't get the choice of white or fried rice like you do at most other trepan restaurants. 
He made us fried rice, it was really nothing special.  The rice seemed old. Doug got the steak done medium. And I got shrimp and chicken. The shrimp was okay, they don't cook it with the sauce which made it a bit bland, and my chicken, was way over cooked, very dry and had no taste. I don' t think he likes to use seasoning. We even hinted to him to add more butter but he didn't take the hint. The steak was cooked okay but again had no seasoning. It was bad. We were asked multiple times if everything was okay, I finally explained to the girl what I felt. She said "oh sorry, I guess our reviews hyped us up too much". Really!?
I wanted to try their sushi at some time but I don't know if I want to even spend my money there again.

I tried because of Groupon.It turned out to be worst restaurant in Las vegas.I asked them if we can have a private Teppan-yaki table.Because we didn't want to sit with big group with small kids.They said there were many reservations after this,so this table is only our choice.So we had to sit on dining room to eat Teppan-yaki.First course salad was watery.It looks like they prepared a long time ago and left in refrigerator.My husband had a chicken teriyaki,which was very chewy and strange taste.It was old teriyaki.Maybe leftover from last night.We has a plate of meat and lobster from kitchen.It was not medium rare and small portion.No show from chef.Then we found out that they lied to us.After big group left,only 1 couple showed up.They had own private table enjoying by themselves.We are very angry.They served us spoiled food and lied.Even with Groupon,bill was $40 plus Groupon$40(paid $20) We didn't leave any tip.We could have gone much better restaurant spending $60.We'll never go back there.

Lets see... Kanji

When walking in, the first impression is clean, classy and fresh. Does not look like a typical "Asian AYCE" sushi bar filled with stupid geisha girl pictures and Japanese paper lamps.. Its really a nice place

The Teppan seats are busy and bustlin' with hungry eater. On this visit we did not try any Teppan but this will be a must next time.

The management here might be family too you if you have been to Jjanga on Twain. They are great at what they do and do it well. They are always a pleasure to dine with.

Fish quality is great! A++ here.. For AYCE they use top notch product. Not like the other places around town ie Oyshi, sushimon -blah gross

Check these guys out theyre killing it and are anticipating on how busy this place will become!!
Amazing drinks amazing staff. Always treat me like family ! Long live  the king of sushi JJANGA! Keep on building your empire and raising the bar in the sushi business
Came here for a Paint Nite event.  I had a blast and the food was great. Got a couple rolls and some appetizers, but wish we had eaten before we painted. Would love to come back again for dinner.

We came to Kanji with a few friends.  And, of course, we started off the night with a couple of drinks.  Sake Bombs and a special drink made by the owner.  Kanji is clean, service is great, and the chef put on a great show at our table. He made a great meal even better by his presentation.  Very visual, from making eggs look like flowers, rice into Square Bob, and the volcano out of the onion rings.  The dinner was not only entertaining but, delicious, from appetizers to main course.    

I just wish our group was as loud, as the other table.  Yelling for Sake Bombs.  Next time we'll have to get a little more rowdy.   This is a great place to bring your close friends and get loud with the staff.  

The only real negative is that the parking lot is really packed and you have to keep going around in circles looking for a space.  

I wish Kanji luck in the future.  The owner and staff are fun and grateful.  Which makes for a great night out.

EDIT 12/2/2014: Chef Hong no longer works there.  Booooooo

I will definitely be a regular now that Chef Hong (ex-Moko) is bringing out his inventive dishes at Kanji.  The former Geisha House location comes off like an Epcot Center restaurant for Japanese food.  The multiple teppanyaki stations, large sushi bar, block wood furniture, full bar, high ceilings and bright lights are very welcoming.  The complimentary sake bomb (one of the best Yelp check-in offers currently) only enhance that feeling.  

Like an amazing movie sequel (very rare), all of Hong's beloved edible characters are here: beef short ribs, 30 hour pork belly, shrimp risotto, in-house smoked fish etc.  They're now being presented with some new and interesting twists from his original, wizardly recipes.  What stay consistent are the flavors, quality and creativity.  There are also some new plates like the excellent miso glazed Chilean seabass and 7 hour pork shoulder.  Seriously.....find me a local sushi joint that's pushing out entrees like these and I will wear a Britney Spears shirt for a week.  

They don't offer AYCE sushi, but the nigiri I've tried has been of excellent quality.  We were informed that they receive fresh shipments every two days which is pretty remarkable.  Kanji also offers a killer late night happy hour from 10pm-2am Monday through Saturday that I plan on checking out pretty soon.

This one is in my top 5 restaurants in Las Vegas!!  We eat here once a week (usually)!  The owner "Ji or G" is wonderful, accommodating and a fantastic business owner.  "Yung or Young" is THE best sushi chef in Vegas, hands down!!  His sushi has us snubbing our noses to all other sushi!  Ellen and Rosa are the hostesses with the mostess!!

They are working on acquiring gluten free soy sauce which would be amazing as I wish that I could order the rice and tepenyaki gluten free!

My favorite rolls are the 1) Taste like my ex girlfriend and 2) The Kanji Roll.  Follow that with some mango sake "ask about the sake sake bomb bomb" and finish off the meal with a mango kochi ball (gluten free).  The chilean sea bass is amazing and their fried rice with the yum yum sauce is a don't miss!!
